resources.string: AIIMS Bhopal is one of the seven AIIMS apex healthcare institutes being established by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojna(PMSSY). With the aim of correcting regional imbalances in quality tertiary level healthcare in the country, and attaining self sufficiency in graduate and postgraduate medical education and training the PMSSY planned to set up 6 new AIIMS like institutions in under served areas of the country.

These institutions are being established by an Act of Parliament on the lines of the original All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi which imparts both undergraduate and postgraduate medical education in all its branches and related fields, along with nursing and paramedical training. to bring together in one place educational facilities of the highest order for the training of personnel in all branches of health care activity.

Welcome to All India Institute of Medical Sciences(A.I.I.M.S.), Bhopal! AIIMS is a superspeciality, tetriary medical care center. This informatics app here, is meant to spread awareness about AIIMS, it\'s functions and various aspects of medical Care.
If at any time you feel stuck, please tap on the \'?\' button displayed on the top right corner of the screen. Please select one of the icons below to get started!
The list below summarizes all the detials of the doctors who provide services at AIIMS,Bhopal. Please refer, and post any complaints if any name is missing on the list. Thank you!
The Govt. of India spends crores on rupees on health and family welfare planning. This investment is also done in the form of various schemes and policies.

"Being aware about these shemes can help you save money in different medical treatments, and will also put the Govt. money to good use. Below are some of the health and family welfare schemes launched by the Govt. of India. Please go through them and find out if you are applicable for any. Think! You could reduce your medical bill by a big margin!
Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana

Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) is an Indian government welfare programme which provides food, preschool education, and primary healthcare to children under 6 years of age and their mothers. These services are provided from Anganwadi centres established mainly in rural areas and staffed with frontline workers. In addition to fighting malnutrition and ill health, the programme is also intended to combat gender inequality by providing girls the same resources as boys.

AIIMS is situated in the Saket Nagar area of New Bhopal. One can reach the hospital by exiting via a left exit NH-12, and traveling straight for about 2 kms. The map below illustrates AIIMS\' location:
->New OPD Card costing Rs. 10/- and shall be valid for 10 days. It can be recharged every 10 days. The follow up visits within up to 10 days is free
-> All Clinics function between 9 am and 1 pm. Registration for new patients is between 8:30 am and 11:30 am
->Patients are seen on first come first serve basis. However, out of turn consultation may be provided in case of emergency or to senior citizens.
->You have right to consult any doctor/ consultant. For seeking appointment with any consultant on his OPD days, you may contact his/her office
->For consultation in Specialty and Super-specialty clinics, you need to have referred from general OPD of AIIMS Bhopal or any Government Institution
->Sample Collection Timings are:- 8:00 AM to 1:30 AM
->Only USG facilities are available on upper ground floor at present. The expansion of services are underway and shall be started shortly.

->Certain investigations are done free of charge while others are charged as per the prevailing norms fixed by Government. Patients should Deposit the money only at the designated hospital Cash Counters and obtain the proper receipt
->The report normally reaches the concerned OPD on the next OPD day
->Certain specialized investigations are done on particular days only

The department of CFM is providing outreach / family care and triage clinic at AIIMS Bhopal hospital and at PHC Ratibadh & Chiklod. More than 2000 families have been attended to by CFM faculty, medical officers, medical students and social workers. These families are on the radar of CFM department.
->To Support state Govt. In implementation of NHPs. & other schemes
->Collaborative Research to generate Evidence to suit local situation.
Teaching & Training to UGs, PGs & Paramdics
UHTC – Urban Health Training Centre Katzu Hospital, Jawahar Chowk, Near Rangmahal Theatre, Bhopal 80-100 patients /day RHTC – Rural Health Training Centre Chiklod , Bhopal 30-50 patients/day

Acute care of haemodynamically stable GI infections, vascular accidents, chest pain, breathlessness have regularly been attended to. Acute care is mostly given to endogenous population. Number of acute patients with life threatening illnesses attended in the past 6 months by AIIMS Bhopal faculty is over 100

Surgical operations under local/regional anaesthesia – biopsies, limited excisional surgery, carpel – tunnel syndrome, NSV – no scalpel vasectomy centre opened. Total no of surgical operations performed in the last 1 year : Gen Surg – 195, Speciality Surg: 110, Gyne :52
